snippet: The judge in the murder trial of David Tarloff, who is charged with killing a psychologist, said he would instruct jurors to keep deliberating, as he did last week.
abstract: Jurors in murder trial of David Tarloff, accused of killing psychologist Kathryn Faughey in her Upper East Side office in 2008, send note to judge, for second time in nine days, insisting that they are deadlocked; Justice Edward J McLaughlin says he intends to tell jurors to keep deliberating.
lead_paragraph: The judge in the murder trial of David Tarloff, who is charged with killing a psychologist, said he would instruct jurors to keep deliberating, as he did last week.

headline.seo: Jurors in Tarloff Murder Case Give 2nd Indication of Deadlock
